After thinking it over you decide to head down the road and resume your travels tomorrow morning. Before starting down the road, however, you check your coin purse and your surroundings. There’s been recent stories about groups of footpads lying in wait on the outskirts of the village…

Introduction
This product provides a nice drop in village for a tabletop fantasy role playing game. This book’s information is presented in a manner that makes it system agnostic but easily compatible with a variety of popular role playing games along with their various editions and house rules spin offs. Game Masters (GM) should have an easy time converting the information presented in this book.
Inside this product you will find a few versions of the community map along with several pages of descriptions provide details of the numbered map locations. Some of these descriptions offer the potential for notable encounter events, possible new hirelings or other travel companions, and adventure hooks.. After the map details you will also find a collection of random roll charts designed to help heighten the experience of visiting Tanner’s Crossing.

Background
Nestled in an area that is filled with nearby smaller farming establishments and some heavily traveled trade routes, the once tiny hamlet of Tanner’s Crossing became a popular resting point for tired merchants and farmers passing through. Such visitors allowed the community to quickly grow into a thriving village with two inns and a rich variety of specialty shops.

Beneath the prosperity of this village lies a growing element of corruption and criminal plotting. Stolen goods are frequently traded on the north side of the village while a flophouse on the south side provides lodging for thieves, fugitives, and drifters. The areas immediately surrounding Tanner’s Crossing are becoming less safe to travel, which defeats the community’s goal of being an inviting place to stop at for a brief rest. The footpads, robbers, and shady conspirers also threaten to hinder the growth of the village’s expansion of population and businesses.

boardgame.name: 20 Belt Pouches
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Collection of Fantasy Belt Pouches and Their Contents

So your rag tag group of adventurers have just finished off a group scoundrels that stand between them and a lair’s worth of fortune. As expected the thief and a couple of others declare that they are going to loot the fallen to see what they might be carrying… and of course each of those foes were carrying a belt pouch…

Ahh yes, the typically boring generic belt pouch… but does such small staple treasure and the pouch itself have to always be boring? Of course not!

boardgame.name: 20 Belt Pouches 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Collection of Fantasy Belt Pouches and Their Contents

So your rag tag group of adventurers have just finished off a group scoundrels that stand between them and a lair’s worth of fortune. As expected the thief and a couple of others declare that they are going to loot the fallen to see what they might be carrying… and of course each of those foes were carrying a belt pouch…

Ahh yes, the typically boring generic belt pouch… but does such small staple treasure and the pouch itself have to always be boring? Of course not!

boardgame.name: 100 1950s Era Bystanders
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 Sci Fi Alien Translations 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of 100 different spoken expressions in a foreign sounding tongue along with their translated meaning. This is perfect for a GM that wants to have the star faring characters encounter someone (or something) speaking a dialect that is not immediately recognizable. Some things might be spoken directly to the characters while other translated expressions may just be overheard conversation.

boardgame.name: 100 Items In Tents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 1 page random roll list features 100 different items that you might find left behind in a tent. Perfect for modern/crime, post apocalypse, and/or zombie outbreak settings.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V20.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: ブンプ星人 (Alien Plotter)
boardgame.description:
In Alien Plotter, players place aliens they encounter along two axis, such as big/small or friendly/unfriendly. In each round, one player places 2 aliens face up as an example of how they interpret the axis labels, and 3 face down. The other players in turn order attempt to guess one of the face down aliens. The alien on the board is then revealed, and both players earn points if the guess is accurate.

Each player has a chance to lead a round, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Mutant Romp!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Humans! Mutants! Robots! High Tech! Low Morals!

Mutant Romp! is a science fantasy tabletop role playing game set in a futuristic apocalyptic world full of strange creatures, numerous hazards, and the bizarre ruins and relics of the Ancients. In this game you take on the role of a nomadic character, often mutant, who goes on various adventurers with your small band of traveling companions. Sometimes you wander the warped lands in search of gaining fortune, glory, and power. Other times your driving force is simply survival related or an attempt to right a wrong.

boardgame.name: Salvaged Vehicles, Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MORE VEHICLES TO DISCOVER AND SALVAGE…

The Mutant Romp! core rulebook provides a good selection of vehicles to add to your campaign. That selection, however, only scratches the surface of all the possible vehicles that the characters might encounter in a Post Catastrophe world. This first volume of Salvaged Vehicles provides over a dozen additional vehicles for the Mutant Romp! table top role playing game.

boardgame.name: Aquatic Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A THREAT EMERGES FROM THE WATERY DEPTHS…

Kalzara was making her morning patrol down by the lake when she heard a sudden splash. Turning around with machete in hand, Kalzara’s eyes widened as she spotted a scaly bear coming up out of the water and headed towards way. “These creatures are always hungry”, thought Kalzara, “and it looks like I’m supposed to be the next meal…”

This product provides over a dozen new encounters to add to your aquatic environments. Full stats are available for each encounter, allowing the Game Master to add new and interesting threats to their Mutant Romp! aquatic environments. There are also three new aquatic themed bonus bloodlines for you to use.

boardgame.name: Character Sheet Mugshots
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you’re working up a new Mutant Romp! character and you’d like to have a nice little image on your character sheet… but you can’t draw a stick figure. No problem! Character Sheet Mugshots is a collection of a dozen Mutant Romp! character sheets with a character image drawn by the game’s co-creator Dan Smith. Pick one and then add the character’s name, stats, and details.

12 Character sheets with illustrated images

boardgame.name: The Scroungers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Scroungers is a drop in mutant gang appropriate for wasteland apocalypse settings. This product is a combination of gang member notes, ready to use hideout location, and mini adventure wrapped up into one. There’s also a random roll chart of assorted consumer and household goods that the gang has scavenged and stored at the building in which they are dwelling.

boardgame.name: dungeon in memory
boardgame.description: In dungeon in memory, players place one tile at a time in a stack. During the game, the players are considering what the path of the tiles would look like if they were laid out according to the direction showed. When a player thinks that the path has run into itself and cannot proceed, they add their "lost" tile into the stack. When all or all but one player have added their "lost" tile to the stack, the players resolve. The tiles are laid out from the start tile and players who accurately predicted when the path could not continue will earn a point. The first player to earn 3 points wins.

boardgame.name: A Generic Armor Shop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A seven page generic Armor Shop allows player characters to interact with the shop owner and make the purchase of armor part of an ongoing adventure. The shop may be added to whichever location the game-master desires. Includes floor plans and shop owner details.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Pirates of the East Isles
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is volume one of a three part campaign spanning years, perhaps even decades. You and your players can leave Dragon Pass behind and be pirates in the mysterious East Isles. Explore an exotic land where each island is a god unto itself. Play new occupations such as Pirate, Sailor and Mystic. Learn a unique martial arts system. Worship all new gods with a completely different mythology than what you've known till now. No Orlanth, no Thed, no Issaries, no Trickster!

boardgame.name: Way of the Wedding
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 2-hour adventure where your choices will have an impact on the story. You choose at the start of the adventure which of three characters you want to help, and their personalities will affect how you act with the adventure. As the adventure is written, there are three possible endings with minor changes to reflect your actions during this adventure.

The adventure takes place inside a domain only reachable through dreams, you and your fellow companions sett out to help a suitor to ask the archfey for their hand in marriage. But to get there you have to pass through a maze filled with wounderous challenges.

This adventure takes place in the EVENTYR DREAM domain. The Archfey is called Renarde Saule.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Garfield - Det drejer sig om: Farver, Former og Tid
Garfield It's All About Colors, Shapes and Time
Garfield og hans venner! Det drejer sig om: Farver, Former og Tid
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Learn and understand with Garfield by playing a variation of small games in order to find the painting that Jon have been working on.

The game is made for 3 years and up.

boardgame.name: VTNL Software Package (VSP)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

VTNL (произносится «Витиэнэль») – пошаговая настольно-компьютерная ролевая игра в фэнтезийном сеттинге.

Главное влияние на общую концепцию VTNL оказала компьютерная стратегия Heroes of Might and Magic II Gold, а также компьютерные rpg серии Might and Magic, Diablo и другие игры 90-ых и начала 2000-ых. Можно сказать, что VTNL – это настольная эмуляция компьютерной ролевой игры, но с живым общением, отыгрышем и азартом от настоящих бросков кубиков.

User summary:

VTNL (pronounced something like Vithienel), or Via The New Legends, currently is a hybrid tabletop roleplaying game and video game (the author refers to it as a "tabletop CRPG"). It best is understood as a traditional tabletop roleplaying game enabled through a rigid computer "interface" that controls character movement, inventory, and especially combat. Play approximates a shared tabletop experience played with enabling technology.

The VTNL Software Package includes two primary components - the "Regionbrowser" (setting and game information) and the "Battleboard" (rules and combat manager).

boardgame.name: VTNL Книга Базовых Правил
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Книга Базовых Правил ("The Book of Basic Rules") is the first book of VTNL! It contains descriptions and examples of basic concepts, elements and rules. And also - the original rules for throwing dice and examples of the game,

boardgame.name: Shadows at Sundown
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's site:
Over ten years ago, the city of Korvosa suffered under the rule of the tyrannical Queen Ileosa. The city has recovered from her rule, but now people are seeing her ghost appearing after dark in places where her cruelty hit particularly hard. Whispers of conspiracies, people vanishing off the streets, and the death of a prominent local religious leader have the city of Korvosa on edge. Can you unravel the truth about this latest threat to the city before it's too late?

"Shadows at Sundown" is a Pathfinder adventure for 11th-level characters. Featuring the potential return of several classic villains, an extensive investigation of a supernatural mystery, and several dangerous locations to explore, this adventure is ready to give your group the chance to save the city of Korvosa from some of its most notorious dangers—or the chance for the heroes to see their final sunset!

boardgame.name: VTNL Реестр
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Реестр ("The Register") is the second book on VTNL. A database consisting of various Registries that contain descriptions and characteristics of items, creatures, skills, locations, etc.

boardgame.name: VTNL дайсфилд
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Легендарный дайсфилд ("the legendary Dicefield") is a special field for dice rolls. This accessory will certainly add "fan" to your game!

User summary:

The game sharply proscribes the method of rolling dice; the Dicefield is a required component. Dice are rolled out of the hand and onto the Dicefield along the open edge.

The Dicefield has generated considerable discussion among gamers - from hostility to bemusement.

boardgame.name: Night of the Gray Death
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's site:
Galt's executioners are the masked and mysterious Gray Gardeners. Held above the laws of the chaotic nation, these grim killers soak the revolution-wracked land in dread and blood. They behead the guilty and innocent alike with their magical guillotines, but few possess the courage to stand against them. Powerful heroes must infiltrate the Gray Gardeners and put an end to their reign of terror. As the heroes race from haunted crypts to the elegant opulence of an ill-fated masque, the midnight chime will bring salvation or doom to a nation.

Night of the Gray Death is a deluxe adventure in Gothic horror for 16th-level characters written by Ron Lundeen. It exposes the secrets of the Gray Gardeners with new monsters, new magic items, and new challenges to test the mightiest heroes. Mysteries and intrigue abound during the Night of the Gray Death!

boardgame.name: Penumbral Curse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

People speak of an area that is so twisted where even the animals there have become sick and deranged. Adventurers now seek to investigate this cursed land.

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 7
Experience from Completion: ~10,000 XP
General Theme: Clearout, Investigation
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: Odyssey of the Dragonlords Poster Map Pack & DM Screen
boardgame.description:
Blurb from the publisher's site:
This Odyssey of the Dragonlords bundle is the perfect playing aid for GMs and contains an attractive four panel GM screen, placing useful information and reference tables at your fingertips while keeping your plans hidden from the eyes of players.

This set also includes 5 large double sided maps and 12 smaller single sided maps.

boardgame.name: Passenger 666
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Secret Agents of CROSS are flying home after completing their previous mission. While over the ocean, they discover that there is a demon spirit on board and he now controls the pilot. Can the agents stop the demon before the plane crashes?

boardgame.name: Hotdog
boardgame.description:
Hotdog is a two player trick-taking game. At the beginning of each round, players will have a chance to pick the card ranking, trump suit, and a special rank. Along with a hand of cards, each player will also be dealt a plate of cards. Plate cards count as part of the player’s hand, but they are visible for all to see.

What sets Hotdog apart from other trick taking games is the choice of rank. During the bidding phase, players can pick whether cards rank normally (Ace - 9), or with the 9 ranked low up through Ace. Players also have the option to play with "the works" meaning the order of rank will change each trick!

Points are awarded based on the outcome of the bidding phase and how many tricks each player captures. The first player to earn 5 game points wins.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: The Veiled Vaults of the Onyx Queen
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

A Level 0 Adventure for DCC RPG

The Queen’s Onyx Jubilee is set to begin, marking the 95th year of the merciful monarch’s glorious reign. While the entire realm celebrates the good fortune of their long-lived sovereign, a group of common villagers fights to stay alive. For them, the festivities have become a nightmare, as the sounds of revelry are replaced by screams of terror – their own!

Imprisoned in opulence, marked for death, hunted by creatures both grotesque and foul. This ragtag group of unsuspecting villagers must band together to brave the vile mysteries that haunt this place and stand defiant in the face of death itself – if they hope to escape the Veiled Vaults of the Onyx Queen and save their very souls!

This 0-level adventure funnel begins in media res with the characters awakening deep within an opulent palace where they are set to become unwitting sacrifices to the corpse-god Mordiggian. There they must piece together the clues as to their whereabouts, contend with a ghoulish death cult, stop a vile sacrament, close a gate to the underworld, and ultimately confront the Corpse-God himself – if they want to escape the Charnel Palace and save their very souls.

- Part dungeon delve, part investigative mystery, the PCs must piece together clues and solve puzzles to help them survive the adventure
- Good mix of puzzles, riddles, monsters, magic, and mayhem
- Character’s alignment and occupation play a large role in shaping the outcomes of certain situations
- Solid thematic reasons for NPCs to choose a class, gain spells, select patrons, and worship certain deities
- Inspired by the works of Clark Ashton Smith and H.P. Lovecraft
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: RosenKreuz
ローゼンクロイツ
boardgame.description:
RosenKreuz is an new abstract strategy game for two players. It uses a checkerboard of 8 x 8 squares, like chess and checkers, but with very different mechanics from both.

The players' pieces are distinguished by symbols, and both have equal numbers of black and white pieces. The object of the game is to capture all of the opponent's pieces of either color.

The game is characterized by three different capture methods. By major capture, you can capture your opponent's pieces by forming a group of the same color with your opponent's pieces and your own pieces. By minor capture, you can capture an enemy piece on a square of a different color than it by replacing. By attainment capture, you can capture any opponent piece by reaching the far end of the board.

Your piece can be moved by jumping over friendly pieces, so the game develops quickly. You need to read the board and make good use of the three capture methods to advance the game to your advantage.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Original Palladium Fantasy Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
"Bonus" Edition - Commemorative Hardcover

Publisher's blurb:

This deluxe, foil stamped edition is being offered due to popular demand. It is the original, First Edition rules, expanded with the inclusion of The Arms of Nargash-Tor. The original edition also includes Erick Wujcik’s popular Tombs of Gersidi adventure left out of the 2nd Edition rule book. The cover is a recreation of the original, famous red and black cover of the original RPG. We sold more than 120,000 copies of the first edition rule book back in the day, so we know a lot of people have fond memories of it. Hence, the request for Palladium to offer it in some form. We hope you enjoy the deluxe hardcover. It sure brought back memories for many of us.

boardgame.name: Splicers Role-Playing Game ("Bonus" Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Splicers RPG plus bonus Splicers material from The Rifter #30, #32, and #51 offering War Mounts, The Wasteland, and Living Weapons like the Swarm Lord, Hive insects, etc.


The complete RPG + 50 pages of bonus material.



Splicers is unique and different. Think Guyver meets Terminator after the rise of the machines.



Humanity armed with genetically engineered living host armor and weapons battle against an insane A.I. and her legion of robots and death machines.



Part science fiction, part horror. Epic in scope.

boardgame.name: Rifts Chaos Earth ("Bonus" Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Great Cataclysm as it unfolds! The Golden Age of Science and human civilization is shattered with the return of magic and the Coming of the Rifts. Humanity struggles to survive against impossible odds as ley lines appear and Rifts tear open the fabric of space and time to unleash all manner of alien invaders, demonic horrors, and monsters. Natural disasters – storms, volcanic eruptions, earthquakes, tidal waves – topple cities and create panic and chaos on a global scale.

You play survivors or the heroes of NEMA (the Northern Eagle Military Alliance) as you battle against the elements, madness, the demonic, the alien, the monstrous, and the magical amidst the devastation. You are equipped with Chromium Guardsmen (Glitter Boys), Silver Eagles (SAMAS), and a host of giant robots, power armor and advanced technology, but is it enough to stand against a rising tide of enemies and invading horrors from other worlds?

You and other survivors are humanity’s last and only hope to survive the apocalypse that will become known as the Great Cataclysm. These are the heroes you play in an ever-changing, nightmare world that can only be described as Chaos Earth.


A complete RPG and the origins of Rifts Earth.
Overview of the Great Cataclysm as it unfolds.
Introduction to NEMA and its weapons and resources.
11 different character classes, including robot pilots, the Para-Arcane, Demon and Witch Hunters, Chromium Guardsmen & more.
Robots, power armor, vehicles, weapons, and equipment.
Monsters, chaos and adventure. Written by Kevin Siembieda.
30 pages of “bonus” material gathered from The Rifter.

boardgame.name: Nightbane ("Bonus" Edition)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At first, people thought Dark Day – the day the sun did not rise anywhere on the planet – was the end of the world. When the sun rose again, everything looked the same, but it wasn’t. Some people have disappeared. Others seem different, darker, crueler, and the world seems more malevolent and dangerous.

Only the newly awakened Nightbane understand that governments and the authorities around the world are being quietly taken over by the sinister Nightlords and their Doppleganger minions. Demonic creatures from a mirror dimension filled with evil and dark magic. Only the Nightbane, born human but who learn they are something else, something more than human, and other creatures that live in the shadows such as vampires and Guardians, dare stand against the gathering darkness.


A role-playing game of modern horror, conspiracy, and self-discovery. A new genre we call superhero-horror.
You play the Nightbane. Mostly young, seemingly ordinary people, who since Dark Day can transform into frightening or beautiful monsters blessed (or cursed) with superhuman powers and magic.
Nightbane creation tables – each a different, horrific, human, or strangely beautiful being who wields powers they must learn to master or fall prey to the Nightlords and their demonic legions. Powers they can only unleash in the monstrous Morphus form.
Nightbane “Talents” are supernatural and magical abilities.
Nearly a dozen other player characters including the Sorcerer, Mystic, Vampire, Wampyre, Guardian and others.
Magic, psionic abilities, and supernatural powers.
Nightlords and their minions: the Hunters, Hounds, Hollow Men, etc.
Wicked Dopplegangers, mirror travel, magic, and more.
The hellish Nightlands, madmen, and adventure ideas.
Compatible with Beyond the Supernatural, and adaptable to Rift, Heroes Unlimited, Ninjas & Superspies, and the entire Palladium Megaverse.
60 pages of “bonus” material gathered from The Rifter.

boardgame.name: Fortress of Terror: Temple of Despair
boardgame.description:
With your victory over the Fortress of Terror and your triumphant defeat of the evil warlord Bram, your village is back to normal, with the townsfolk resuming their daily routines in peaceful naivety. However, a dark power still exists in the realm, and lies within an ancient temple of great evil known as the Temple of Despair. If it is not destroyed, Bram will return, and he will be so powerful that none will be able to stop him.

There are four ancient temples in the Wildlands, but you don't know which temple you must destroy. You must
visit the many ancient ruins strewn across the Wildlands, searching for clues to the location of the Temple of Despair. Fortunately, some of these ruins contain powerful
Relics that will help you in your quest. But beware, the dark, oppressive power of the Temple of Despair is far-reaching and will pursue you relentlessly, so that you can never retrace your steps!

Temple of Despair is the second Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.

-description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Railways of the Lost Atlas
boardgame.description:
Railways of the Lost Atlas is an 18xx style game set in a shifting landscape. The map, built by players as part of setup, is different for each play. Players take on the roll of individual investors, launching minor companies, building infrastructure, and generating revenue to increase their stock value or reinvest in the company. Minors eventually merge into majors that have more freedom to expand their operations.

The 12 minor companies have distinct abilities that persist even after merging into a major to make for exciting combinations and unique identities.

Enjoy multiple game modes and modular options that allow groups to tailor the game to their needs.

boardgame.name: Oltakozz okosan!
boardgame.description:
Oltakozz okosan! is a hungarian Roll and Move game about the Covid-19, where players fight the virus by trying to vaccinate themselves and earn the Covid Certification. In addition players can get the infection if they are not careful enough or if someone else infects them.

Players has to get two of the same vaccines from the Hospital and a Covid Certificate from the Government Office. They can only get vaccinated if they are not infected, this applies to the Covid Certificate as well. When somebody has all of above and not infected at the moment, wins the game. If the game applies to be too short this way, they can play until getting the third vaccine.

boardgame.name: Mono
boardgame.description:
Players race to empty their hands. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile and pass their turn. The special cards can spice things up a bit.

Mono card game is based on UNO and SOLO, is a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.

boardgame.name: Rifts: Atlantis and the Demon Seas
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Atlantis is a mysterious continent steeped in cataclysmic history, and shrouded from North America by the treacherous Demon Seas. Those mortals who manage to travel to the continent, or wash up on its shores, are in for a ruthless awakening.

Though timeless fables tell of a land of splendor and advanced human civilization, the monsters which now inhabit the dread continent are cruel in the extreme. Their Atlantis is a land of slavery, subjugation, and exploitation. It is a massive isle ruled by the Splugorth entity known as Splynncryth—a cosmic evil unparalleled in the depraved, the alien, and the bizarre.

Already the unquestioned master and ruler of multiple worlds and servitor races, this chthonic being finds entertainment in the mayhem of Rifts Earth and sees her inhabitants as his playthings. There are few more malevolent forces that could take root in the world, and yet by attempting to seek out the most enjoyment and advantage for himself, Splynncryth is allowing the world to continue on largely without his involvement.

boardgame.name: Rifts for Savage Worlds Dragon Juicer Preview
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Originally perfected in the independent city of Kingsdale (east and slightly north of Castle Refuge in the wilds of southern Missouri), the process of creating Dragon Juicers now offers one more method by which Lord Dunscon plans to build an unstoppable army. Techno-Wizards (and at least one radical dragon practitioner of alchemy and magic) experimented at great length with dragon blood as a supplement for the normal biochemical stew that gives a Juicer his power. Further empowered with supernatural might, a Dragon Juicer is a frightening thing... but also additionally burdened, as he craves life-giving dragon blood while still facing an early death.

boardgame.name: Savage Rifts GM Screen Inserts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Artwork & tables for the Savage Worlds customizable game master's screen.

boardgame.name: Rifts: Powers & Mega Powers List
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[A] complete list compiling all of the core Savage Worlds powers along with their Mega Powers versions from Rifts: The Tomorrow Legion Player's Guide.

The relation to Rifts: The Mega Power List isn't clear.

boardgame.name: Warlock Lairs: Into the Wilds
boardgame.description:
Description from the publisher's site:

The Wilderness Calls
The bugs gather in thick, buzzing clouds, constantly biting. The leaves twist in the breeze, casting strange shadows. You almost stepped in some weird monster scat. Life is good. You’re on an adventure:


Brave the untamed wilderness, meeting new people and discovering strange creatures
Explore lands all but forgotten, from the blasted Wasted West to the lush Arbonesse to the harsh Northlands
Throw yourself into 18 wild adventures!


Warlock Lairs: Into the Wilds presents fourteen wilderness-themed Warlock Lairs, collected here with four brand-new adventures. Ranging from 1st to 10th level, there’s so much to discover. The opportunities for secrets and treasures are great–and so are the risks. But you wouldn’t have it any other way.

Explore the wilds of the Midgard campaign setting or worlds of your own creation!

Fully compatible with the 5th Edition ruleset

boardgame.name: Savage Frontier Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

D&D - Savage Frontier Map
GF9's Official Dungeons & Dragons® Savage Frontier Map has a high-quality vinyl surface, ideal for tracking the progress of your adventures during the Storm King’s Thunder campaign. The Savage Frontier lies between the Sword Coast and the desert of Anauroch, extending as far north as Icewind Dale and as far south as the city of Waterdeep.

The denizens of the North are accustomed to cool, mild summers and fierce, bitter winters. Beacons of civilization hug the Sword Coast and dot the fertile river valleys, yet despite the abundant natural resources and scenic beauty, survival is a day-to-day concern for the people who live here.

Vinyl Game Mat 21"x31".

boardgame.name: Out of the Abyss Map Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Underdark is a subterranean wonderland, a vast and twisted labyrinth where fear reigns. It is the home of horrific monsters that have never seen the light of day.

Out of the Abyss Underdark Map Set has a high-quality vinyl surface, ideal for tracking the progress of your adventures during the campaign.

The Underdark Vinyl Map Measures 20.5 in x 16.5 in

Menzoberranzan Vinyl Map Measures 22.75 in x 16.5 in

boardgame.name: Curse of Strahd Map Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Curse of Strahd Map set will aid you in your next campaign against the evil count! Find your way to Castle Ravenloft or wander into the village of Barovia. Whatever you choose, these maps are here to help you.

Curse of Strahd Bavovia Map Set has a high-quality vinyl surface, ideal for tracking the progress of your adventures during the campaign.

Barovia Map 24" x 16"
Vallaki Map 14" x 9"
Village of Barovia Map 10" x 13"

boardgame.name: La Sombra de Saros
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Año 1924. La floreciente ciudad de Bloomfield, Massachusetts, ofrece una nueva a todo aquel que esté dispuesto a luchar duro por ella. Pero nada es lo que parece en esta ciudad. Sus oscuros secretos pondrán a prueba la resistencia física y mental de los que se atrevan a llegar demasiado lejos.

En "La Sombra de Saros" interpretarás a un recién llegado a Bloomfield que deberá abrirse paso entre los tejemanejes de la ciudad. ¿Qué se esconde tras la trágica muerte del pequeño Jerome Miller? ¿Qué oscura motivación alimenta la guerra de bandas? ¿Quién es el misterioso hombre del turbante? Cada paso que des será clave para el deselance de la campaña.

"La Sombra de Saros" es una campaña de rol de horror lovecraftiano para 3-6 jugadores. No es un producto independiente: necesitas una copia del reglamento de "Cthulhu d100" o de "Ratas en las paredes" para poder jugar.

boardgame.name: Hostage Rescue Squad: A Solitaire Game
boardgame.description:
The Hostage Rescue Squad is a (fictional) elite tactical unit set up to rescue hostages from critical situations when negotiation had failed or is simply not an option. In the game you will be controlling three HRS Operators as they attempt daring missions to rescue hostages in a variety of missions. The Hostiles who have taken the hostages are dangerous and desperate and they will stop at nothing to prevent you succeeding in your mission. Stealth will often be the key tactic here, although sudden bursts of action are likely to be required at the right moments.

This book is a solitaire game. You play the game, and the book will provide the “enemy”. You will need to add 7 standard six-sided dice.

Game counters have been included at the end of the book which you can cut out or copy, and stick to card if you wish. This makes the game quicker to play. Some people might decide to photocopy the maps or use some kind of acetate sheet and dry-wipe pens, and others may even want to create their own counters or use miniatures or tokens that they already possess. Rules and mission maps are included in full colour.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Crónicas de Bloomfield: Sangre en las calles
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Bloomfield, año 1924. Una sombra se cierne sobre la ciudad, afectándo a sus habitantes de múltiples maneras. Dos clanes mafiosos, los italianos Bonucci y los irlandeses McAllister, han roto una duradera tregua a causa de la nueva droga que está introduciendo el clan irlandés en la ciudad. El equilibrio pende de un hilo y Valentina Bonucci, la mujer del Don italiano ha contratado a los Gattara, un grupo de Nueva York con fama de resolver cualquier problema, por complicado que parezca.
En este one shot los jugadores interpretarán a los miembros de dicho grupo y se zambullirán de lleno en la guerra de la mafia que se narra en La Sombra de Saros. Algunos aspectos de la trama y escenas de la campaña se revelan en esta aventura, por lo que no recomiendo jugarla si todavía no has hecho lo propio con la campaña.
El tiempo de la tregua y los acuerdos ha pasado, es hora de empuñar las armas. Si quieres la paz dice el dicho, prepara la guerra.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Crónicas de Bloomfield: Sangre en las calles

boardgame.name: Calendario Bloomfield Gazette
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Calendario de mesa de enero de 1924 a enero de 1925, el tiempo durante el cual se desarrolla la campaña "La Sombra de Saros". El calendario contiene todo tipo de información, desde las fases lunares, hasta los días de mercado en Bloomfield, así como diversas efemérides de interés. Será una útil herramienta para poder llevar el cómputo del paso del tiempo en la campaña, así como la cronología de los diferentes capítulos, de una manera rápida, eficaz y con mucho estilo.

boardgame.name: Mythic Britain and Ireland
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Leave the Mythic North and set sail for the mist-shrouded isles of Mythic Britain and Ireland. Explore the bustling streets of London, discover the secrets of Rose House and the British Society. Roam the islands and walk the moors in search of long-lost tales and ancient remnants.

In this expansion to the award-winning Vaesen – Nordic Horror Roleplaying you will find a complete guide to the supernatural British-Irish Isles including the great city of London and the countryside beyond. Mythic Britain & Ireland is written by industry legend Graeme Davis and illustrated by Johan Egerkrans and Anton Vitus.

Key features:
- Information about the British Society, its founders, and headquarters.
- A gazetteer of the sprawling city of London, complete with adventure locations and secret societies.
- A guide to the mythology of Mythic Britain & Ireland, with information on a score of mythological locations across the islands.
- A chapter detailing several mythical beings with stats, background information, story seeds, and variants.
- Three new complete mysteries to play.

boardgame.name: Seasons of Mystery
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Still are the forests large and small,
wrapped in the frosty white,
only the distant waterfall
murmurs and hums in the night.
The nisse listens and, half in dream,
thinks it is time’s ceaseless stream,
wonders which way it is going,
And from what source it is flowing.
– VIKTOR RYDBERG

Within these pages you will find four spine-tingling cases for Vaesen – Nordic Horror Roleplaying. This book contains four standalone mysteries, one for each season of the year:
- A Dance with Death – Travel to the green vales of Dalarna in the springtime to investigate strange events in a remote village.
- Fireheart – During the summer heatwave of the century, journey south to the ironworks of Häryd and confront a fearsome adversary.
- The Devil on the Moor – On the autumnal moors of Denmark, find yourselves in a struggle between the ways of old and the
designs of modernity.
- A Winter’s Tale – Cross the Baltic Sea and brave the wintry forests of Ingria, where an unknown being stalks the night beneath glittering stars.

boardgame.name: Dynamis
boardgame.description:
It's about God and the world and a dream of congregations. Each player directs one of eight congregations that thrives, grows and prospers: the Catholic cathedral, a national Protestant church, a classic free church, a start-up, the small-town congregation, the city church, the event church or a international congregation.
You win by doubling the worship attendance to 150 visitors, by raising all your qualities to the value 7 or by a third way - because it is about the triune God - but this is a secret and can only be experienced in the game.
To do so, the players are playing cards and roll dice.
The game is played in rounds of three phases:
Phase 1: Reflection - Draw up to five cards.
Phase 2: Use - Play up to three cards and throw dices for most of it.
Phase 3: Traditions - Applying of exisiting traditions and establishing new traditions, which give you "bonus" till end of the game(traditions cannot be abolished that easy so bonus may become bothersome later).

boardgame.name: Sangre nueva
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A mediados de los años 50, policía y ejército colaboraron en una operación a gran escala en las cercanías de Madrid. Debido al férreo control de los medios de comunicación, el gobierno consiguió que no saliese a la luz. Treinta años después, la desaparición de Nerea de la Fuente, una joven promesa de la biología del desarrollo, destapará aquello que se trató de ocultar. Los investigadores iniciarán una búsqueda en la que su moral y sus propias creencias se tambalearán.

boardgame.name: De repente
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Es una noche de verano de 1933. Un equipo cinematográfico llega a una casa en un bosque cercano a Arkham, propiedad del productor de la película, para rodar unas escenas de exteriores. Pero la caída repentina de un meteorito en una zona cercana desatará un auténtico infierno. ¿Lograrán salir con vida de esta pesadilla o quedarán atrapados para siempre en el horror?

boardgame.name: La casa de muñecas
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

En la vieja mansión donde os habéis alojado, hay una pieza de decoración que os llama la atención desde el principio: una preciosa casa de muñecas, que parece que se haya quedado congelada en el tiempo. Esa noche, mientras dormís, os encontraréis en su interior, intentando desentrañar el misterio que os deja allí atrapados… ¿para siempre?

boardgame.name: Luddomo
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Una misteriosa carta. Un excéntrico millonario aficionado a los enigmas. Una invitación inquietante a la que no os podéis negar. Un juego ideado por una mente perversa que pondrá a prueba vuestro ingenio. ¿Saldréis airosos del reto o sucumbiréis al horror?

boardgame.name: El recolector de gusanos
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Londres, 12 de enero de 1838. Una constante tormenta eléctrica va tomando la ciudad y oleadas de insectos y alimañas recorren las calles en busca de un lugar seguro.
Sir Thomas Tennyson ha pedido a su sobrino Gerald que reúna a un grupo de investigadores para encontrar el cadáver de su hijo, un niño de tan solo cinco años, fallecido debido al efecto de una extraña enfermedad.
Sin mucho preámbulo, Gerald pide a los personajes que lo ayuden a encontrar el cadáver desaparecido de Leonard Tennyson, hijo de Sir Thomas, enterrado hace tan solo tres días en el cementerio de West Norwood, en el distrito de Lambeth. Les explica que la policía metropolitana tiene preso al resurrector, un tal Lewis Thorpe. Sin embargo el individuo no colabora, e incluso insiste en su inocencia. Mientras tanto, el cuerpo del pequeño no aparece por ninguna parte y su tumba se haya vacía, sin posibilidad de ser velada por la familia.
Los personajes recibe un permiso del sheriff que les permite interrogar al acusado (Lewis) en la prisión de Newgate. También, claro está, tienen permiso de la familia para pasarse por el cementerio de Norwood y ver la escena del crimen.

boardgame.name: Guía de la isla de Farzeen
boardgame.description:
From the book:

La remota isla de Farzeen se erige en un mar revuelto, a miles de millas del puerto amistoso más cercano. Exuberante, verde y repleta de vida, una densa jungla crece alrededor del imponente volcán Kaza, visible desde casi cualquier punto de la isla. Este se eleva cerca de la costa meridional de Farzeen, pero las raíces de la montaña se extienden a través de la isla, creando una red de crestas y valles que definen la accidentada geografía de la región.

boardgame.name: IBU
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

La humanidad ha trascendido. Algunos llaman a estos tiempos «la Era Inmortal».
IBU es la IA de la nave en la que viajáis hacia el centro del universo. Vuestra consciencia está descargada en el sistema de IBU y vuestros cuerpos descansan vacíos de vosotros. Pero algo anda mal, IBU está fallando...
Una aventura transhumanista en la que corréis el riesgo de quedaros atrapados en el limbo cuántico por toda la eternidad.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: El portador de hielo
boardgame.description:
Introducción:

Cuando la ciudad de Hamilton, Montana, comenzó a padecer inesperadamente un clima ártico, el NGT envió un equipo especial a investigar la causa de la anomalía.
El Portador de Hielo es una aventura ambientada en Cthulhutech diseñada para personajes principiantes.
La misión proporciona una forma rápida para crear un nuevo grupo de personajes y les provee de un objetivo común. Esto puede, de hecho, formar la base para una campaña, puesto que el clímax del escenario facilita varios caminos a seguir para futuras investigaciones.

boardgame.name: 51.2 The Manchurian Incident
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Bienvenido al Beijing de la Guerra del Eón.
Adéntrate en sus peligrosas calles, pasea bajo la cúpula que lo aísla del mundo. Rige tus pasos en función de los designios del Consejo Popular y enfréntate a la ira de la Tormenta Devastadora.

51.2 The Manchurian Incident es una aventura eminentemente investigativa para el juego de rol CthulhuTech, desarrollada con la intención de servir como partida introductoria a los grupos de juego que deseen adentrarse en el fascinante mundo de la Guerra del Eón.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Vastitas Borealis
boardgame.description:
Vastitas Borealis is a new board for Terraforming Mars with new milestones and awards:

Special Rules

Place a tile on Viking 1 and Viking 2 areas and get a delegate for free. Put these delegate to the delegate area of your desired party.
Place a tile on temperature area and raise temperature for 4 MC.


Milestones

Agronomist - have 4 plant tags
Spacefarer - have 5 space tags
Geologist - have 4 tiles on and/or at vulcanic areas
Engineer - achieve 10 energy/heat production
Farmer - have 6 animals/microbes-resources
Hoverlord - have 7 floater resources


Awards:

Traveller - most planet tags (Jovian/Earth)
Landscaper - most adjacent tiles
Highlander - most tiles NOT adjacent to ocean tiles
Promoter - most event cards
Blacksmith - most steel/titanium production
Venuphile - most venus tags

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Terra Cimmeria
boardgame.description:
Terra Cimmeria is a new board for Terraforming Mars, with new milestones and awards:

Special rules

Place a tile on MSL Curiosity area and get a colony for just 5 MC.


Milestones

Planetologist - achieve 5 planet tags (Earth, Jovian, Venus)
Architect - have 3 city tags
Coastguard - have 4 tiles adjacent to ocean tiles
Forester - have 5 plant production
Investor - have 13 MC production
Hoverlord - have 7 floater resources


Awards

Electrician - most energy tags
Founder - most tiles adjacent to special tiles
Mogul - most production except MC
Zoologist - most animal/microbe resources
Forecaster - most blue/green card

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Tharsis – Big Board Edition
boardgame.description: A big board edition of the Terraforming Mars board, with space for all the elements of the different expansions.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Hellas – Big Board Edition
boardgame.description: A big board edition of the Hellas board for Terraforming Mars, with space for all the elements of the different expansions.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Elysium – Big Board Edition
boardgame.description: A big board edition of the Elysium board for Terraforming Mars, with space for all the elements of the different expansions.

boardgame.name: Grunt to zdrowie
boardgame.description:
This board game has been published together with two other Polish games "Gierki Małżeńskie and "Kariera Polityczna" in a series of games illustrated by famous cartoonist Andrzej Mleczko.

Grunt to zdrowie is a party game where you and your fellow geriatric friends race to see medical specialists. Start in the ER and stand in the queue for hours to finally get an appointment with a gastrologist to treat your pinworms or psychologist to help with your egocentrism. Go to work, get more money and let your health deteriorate or get a prescription and heal yourself to win!

The game starts with pawn racing to the ER. Players draw cards and count the number of plaster icons on all of them to move forward and avoid losing points at the end of the game. To visit a doctor, bids are secretly made by choosing cards with the earliest appointment times and modifying them with time tokens. Then, patients in individual queues fight with each other to get to the doctor's by dexterity tests. Manage to be the first one in the queue and visit all the doctors you need to before you lose all your health points and win the game as the only one standing!

boardgame.name: Necesse
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




The game is still in active development, but a version of it has been made available to the public for purchase - Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




Go underground

Explore the world of different bosses, monsters, biomes, cave systems, villages, dungeons and more. Mine, find treasure, craft armor, weapons, potions, food and more to prepare your character for the next challenge.

Build your own settlements

Start your settlement and recruit settlers to work for you. Manage your settlers, keep them happy, trade with them and fight off threats that want to invade your settlement. Build a farm, go fishing and supply yourself with food and powerful potions and buffs that will help you progress through the game.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Werwolf: Insurgency in Occupied Germany 1945-48
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the COIN series, Werwolf is an asymmetric, alternate history strategy game for 1-4 players.

It is 1945 and Germany has been invaded and occupied by the exhausted forces of the Soviet Union and Western Allies. Unlike in our timeline, the fighting continues as German resistance fighters engage in a prolonged guerrilla war. With the Manhattan Project still incomplete, Japan fighting on and the Allied invasion of Europe losing millions of men, the Allies are war-weary and there is pressure to bring the troops home. While the Wehrmacht was defeated, the Nazi leadership has spent 1943 onwards building up a huge secret guerrilla force – Werwolf - to turn the occupation of Germany into a costly quagmire. Other groups calling themselves the Edelweiss Movement are opposed to the Nazis but also to the invaders and will fight to restore an independent and patriotic Germany. The Fuhrer himself has gone missing, and many Nazi officials are in hiding, perhaps awaiting their chance to return to power.
Four factions are now competing for control and the loyalty of the German population: the Allied Occupation Forces (Western Allied Troops and German police, referred to as Allies in the rules) the Soviet Union (the Red Army and NKVD, referred to as Soviets in the rules), the Edelweiss Movement (patriotic but anti-Nazi German resistance, referred to as Edelweiss in the rules) and the Werwolf organisation (former SS and other Nazi fanatics trained in guerrilla warfare, referred to as Werwolf in the rules). The struggle will be not only for military control and the hearts and minds of the German people but also over the remnants of the Nazi war machine and research programs. The Soviets and Allies may reluctantly co-operate to crush German guerrillas but will compete to secure top German scientists and prototypes for their own arms race. As the Allies try to de-Nazify the populace and entice them with American pop culture, the Soviets will use everything from indoctrination to mass deportation to keep Germany under control. Loyalties will be split between democracy, communism and resurgent fascism or nationalism. This will not be an easy occupation…

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Reavers of Midgard: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden insert for Reavers of Midgard

boardgame.name: The Grand Trunk Journey: Berlin Con Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion is composed of 4 promo cards developed for the Spiele-Offensive Berlin Con crowdfunding campaign.

Improvement cards:

CITY HUB: The player can place a City or a Port card in reserve on this card. The city or port can come from their hand or their train (when they remove the card from the front of their train). The player spends 1 Day to take the City card and place it in front of their train during step 1 (but not back in their hand). They can discard the City card without spending a day.

DISPATCHER: The Grand Trunk Jct card allows the player to reach a city without a terminal.

Objective cards

EXPANSION TO BERLIN
Requirement: The player collected 2 or more each of Coal, Iron and Steel and the train of the player must be in Hamilton.
Score: 5 VP
During the 19th century, the city of Kitchener (Ontario), which is located about 60 km northwest of Hamilton, was called Berlin. The Grand Trunk Railway built a station in Berlin in 1856.

NEW MARKETS
Requirement: The player collected 3 or more first delivery tokens.
Score: 1 VP/1st delivery token collected

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dashboard Mat
boardgame.description:
14" x 24" neoprene playmat

Organize your Car Wars Sixth Edition vehicle in style with this 14” x 24” custom playmat depicting a Car Wars dashboard and more! With spaces for your equipment cards as well as your Control and Ace tokens, it even has helpful info like turn phases and build points.

Available in four colors.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Uncle Al's Arena Supplies #1
boardgame.description:
Barriers to avoid! Barriers to run into!

A bagged set of 3D-printed barriers that includes:

- One Jersey Barrier
- Two barrels
- Two drums
- Three cones

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Wrecks
boardgame.description:
Box of four "wrecked" pre-assembled, unpainted miniatures to clutter up your track!

Includes:

- Dragon, Scarab, Avalanche, and Typhoon wrecks
- 4 clear bases

boardgame.name: Wreck
boardgame.description:
Wreck is a two player card game of strategy and cunning. The goal is to be the first to at least 21 points at the end of your turn. Each turn, a player can draw a card or play a card (either as points or as an effect). Players can prevent their opponent from winning by playing cards to attack: capturing or removing cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Provenance
boardgame.description:
In Provenance you assume the role of an amateur antiques dealer. The aim of the game is to make as much profit as possible by buying and selling antiques. Take advantage of market trends to sell your items when there is a higher demand, but be careful not to hold on to or hoard too many items as that comes with hefty storage fees.

Spend time researching items to make safer buys, but don't wait too long as the item may be bought by a more daring dealer. Does your item have a secret royal connection? Or is it a piece of junk?

Provenance is a 2-5 player card game that uses a unique 'Provenance deck system' to determine the worth of the thirty item cards in the game. Provenance is simple to play, but offers plenty of tense choices from start to finish.

—description from the designer
